availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: E. A. Herman Beyland (Newport, Campbell County, Kentucky, soldier (U.S.A))

body.p: Newport, Campbell County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Native of Germany. Son of Catherine Beyland and C. F. Beyland. Resident in Newport, Campbell County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the Ninth Ohio Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from May 27, 1861 to June 7, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 506.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Campbell County Marriages, Film #000459907, p. 252.
Find A Grave, "Ernst Adolph Herman Beyland (1841-1918)," Memorial #90078833, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/90078833 (accessed May 24, 2019).
U.S., Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934 (The Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, 1773-2007), NARA RG #15 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1866, vol. 2 (Cincinnati: Wilstach, Baldwin & Co., 1886), 267.
